meanings.definition: The act of making something political.
meanings.sent1: The politicalization of the school board led to heated debates among parents.
meanings.sent2: The politicalization of the issue caused division among the community members.
meanings.sent3: The politicalization of choosing a class pet resulted in a fierce argument over which animal to pick.
meanings.sent4: The politicalization of the playground game turned a simple activity into a battleground of strategies.
meanings.sent5: The politicalization of the bake sale made it feel like a high-stakes competition.

meanings.definition: The process of bringing something under political control or influence.
meanings.sent1: The politicalization of the company by the government raised concerns among employees.
meanings.sent2: The politicalization of the media industry affected the way news was reported.
meanings.sent3: The politicalization of the office coffee machine led to strict rules on its usage.
meanings.sent4: The politicalization of the neighborhood watch turned it into a surveillance operation.
meanings.sent5: The politicalization of the family dinner turned it into a debate forum.
